par.text: Thulium occurs in nature only in the combined state, chiefly in monazite sand, which is a mixture of the phosphates of cerium, thorium, lanthanum and other lanthanides. These elements constitute about 50% of monazite, whereas the content of thulium is found to be a mere 0.07%. In terms of abundance in the Earth's crust thulium ranks 61st among the elements, making up 4.8 ·
of the Earth's crust by weight.
